title: 112_s3284
content: The Act titled "South Carolina Offshore Drilling Act" deals with oil and gas leasing off the coast of South Carolina. Section 18 of the Outer Continental Shelf Lands Act is amended to authorize lease sales off the coast of South Carolina, including definitions for qualified revenues and the State of South Carolina. The Governor of South Carolina, with the State legislature's approval, can request the Secretary to lease areas within the State's administrative boundaries that are between 10 and 50 miles off the coast. The Secretary must approve the petition within 90 days. The Governor of South Carolina, with the State legislature's approval, can request the Secretary to lease areas within the State's administrative boundaries that are between 10 and 50 miles off the coast. The Secretary must approve the petition within 90 days, and if not approved, it is considered approved after 90 days. The Secretary must then treat the approved petition as a proposed action within 180 days. The Governor of South Carolina can request the Secretary to lease areas within the State's boundaries 10-50 miles off the coast. The Secretary must approve the petition within 90 days, and if not approved, it is considered approved after 90 days. The approved petition is treated as a proposed revision to a leasing program, initiating a new 5-year outer Continental Shelf oil and gas leasing program. The Secretary must include areas covered by a petition in lease sales under the 5-year outer Continental Shelf oil and gas leasing program without consulting any State. Before modifying the program for the next 5-year period, an environmental assessment must be completed to describe the anticipated environmental effects of leasing in the petitioned area. The Governor of a State, with the State legislature's agreement, can petition the Secretary to prohibit leasing areas more than 50, but less than 100, miles off the State's coast. The Secretary must approve the petition within 90 days of receiving it. DISPOSITION OF QUALIFIED OUTER CONTINENTAL SHELF REVENUES. Section 18 of the Outer Continental Shelf Lands Act is amended to include revenue sharing for additional areas. Coastal States requesting leasing in an outer Continental Shelf area will receive 37.5 percent of bonus bids and post-leasing revenues without further appropriation. This includes lease rental payments, lease royalty payments, and royalty proceeds from a sale of royalties. The Secretary will distribute revenue from bonus bids, lease rental payments, lease royalty payments, and royalty proceeds among coastal political subdivisions. Additionally, a conservation royalty of 12.5 percent of Federal royalty revenues will be distributed without further appropriation. The Secretary will distribute revenue from bonus bids, lease rental payments, lease royalty payments, and royalty proceeds among coastal political subdivisions. Additionally, 50 percent of Federal royalty revenues derived from all leased areas will go to the Land and Water Conservation Fund for financial assistance to States, and 50 percent will be allocated to direct Federal deficit reduction.
